text: The different pulmonary MΦs exhibited rounded or elongated morphology, an indented nucleus and abundant cytoplasm. Interstitial MΦs (IMΦs), pulmonary intravascular MΦs (PIM) and pulmonary alveolar MΦs (PAM) are localized in distinct anatomical compartments of the lung, including connective tissue, being adhered to the endothelium in the pulmonary capillaries and air spaces, respectively. PIM and IMΦs were grouped together and are described as
